tit.e: Igashi no Hen (Incident of the Iga clan)

Igashi no Hen (Incident of the Iga clan)

sen.j: 伊賀氏の変（いがしのへん）とは、鎌倉時代前期の貞応3年（1224年）6月から閏月7月にかけて起こった鎌倉幕府の政変事件のことである。
sen.e: Igashi no Hen is the political turmoil happened in Kamakura Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which lasted about a month from June, 1224, in the early Kamakura period.
Igashi no Hen is a political turmoil that happened in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which lasted about a month from June 1224 in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ・happanは自動詞ですので、thatを加えました。・Juneは数字ではないため、「1224」前後のコンマは不要です。・統一のため、Bakufu→bakufuとしました。・鎌倉幕府の政変は1つに限定できないため、political turmoilは不定冠詞としました。
sen.e: Igashi no Hen is a political turmoil that happened in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which lasted about a month from June 1224 in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 北条義時の死去に伴い、伊賀光宗とその妹で義時の後妻伊賀の方が、伊賀の方の実子北条政村の執権就任と、娘婿一条実雅の将軍職就任を画策した。
sen.e: Due to the death of Yoshitoki HOJO, Mistumune IGA and Iga no kata, his younger sister and the second wife of Yoshitoki, schemed to have Masamura HOJO, her biological son, to assume the position SHIKKEN, a regent to the Shogunship, and to have Sanemasa ICHIJO, her son-in-law, to assume the Shogunship.

Due to the death of Yoshitoki HOJO, Mistumune IGA and Iga no kata, his younger sister and the second wife of Yoshitoki, schemed to have Masamura HOJO, her biological son, to assume the position of shikken, regent to the shogunate, and to have Sanemasa ICHIJO, her son-in-law, to assume the Shogunship.
sen.cmt: ・「執権」の訳語は対訳に合わせました。
sen.e: Due to the death of Yoshitoki HOJO, Mistumune IGA and Iga no kata, his younger sister and the second wife of Yoshitoki, schemed to have Masamura HOJO, her biological son, to assume the position of shikken, regent to the shogunate, and to have Sanemasa ICHIJO, her son-in-law, to assume the Shogunship.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伊賀光宗は鎌倉御家人の中でも実力のあった三浦義村と結ぶ。
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA approaches Yoshimura MIURA, a powerful Gokenin, the shogunal retainer of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA approached Yoshimura MIURA, a powerful Gokenin, the shogunal retainer of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 過去のことなので、時制を過去にしました。
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA approached Yoshimura MIURA, a powerful Gokenin, the shogunal retainer of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伊賀氏の不穏な動きを察した尼将軍北条政子は、義時の長男であった北条泰時を執権に就任させる。
sen.e: The Ama Shogun (the nun-shogun) Masako HOJO, sensing the threatening move of the Iga clan, had Yasutoki HOJO, the oldest son of Yoshiaki HOJO, assume the position of Shikken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Ama Shogun (the nun-shogun) Masako HOJO, sensing the threatening move of the Iga clan, had Yasutoki HOJO, the oldest son of Yoshitoki HOJO, assume the position of Shikken.
sen.cmt: Yoshiaki→Yoshitokiの誤記と思われます。
sen.e: The Ama Shogun (the nun-shogun) Masako HOJO, sensing the threatening move of the Iga clan, had Yasutoki HOJO, the oldest son of Yoshitoki HOJO, assume the position of Shikken.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、三浦義村に対し、泰時への支持を確約させ、伊賀氏の政変を未然に防ぐことに成功した。
sen.e: She succeeded in preventing the political change the Iga clan plotted by securing Yoshimura MIURA commit to support Yasutoki HOJO.
She succeeded in preventing the political change the Iga clan plotted by ensuring Yoshimura MIURA's commitment to support Yasutoki HOJO.
sen.cmt: securing以降が不完全な構文になっていましたので修正しました。
sen.e: She succeeded in preventing the political change the Iga clan plotted by ensuring Yoshimura MIURA's commitment to support Yasutoki HOJO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これにより伊賀の方・光宗・実雅は流罪となったが、彼らに担ぎ上げられそうになった当の政村は厳罰を免れ後に第7代執権に就任している。
sen.e: However Iga no kata, Mitsumune IGA, and Sanemasa ICHIJO were exiled for the plot, Masamura HOJO, whom they tried to put to be the regent, escaped severe punishment and assumed the seventh Shikken position later.

Although Iga no kata, Mitsumune IGA, and Sanemasa ICHIJO were exiled for the plot, Masamura HOJO, whom they tried to make the regent, escaped severe punishment and assumed the seventh Shikken position later.
sen.cmt: ・Howeverは副詞ですので、Althoughに修正しました。・put to beは不自然なため、makeに修正しました。
sen.e: Although Iga no kata, Mitsumune IGA, and Sanemasa ICHIJO were exiled for the plot, Masamura HOJO, whom they tried to make the regent, escaped severe punishment and assumed the seventh Shikken position later.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上記の通説は幕府の編纂書『吾妻鏡』貞応3年6月28日条に記された伊賀氏謀反の「風説」を事実と認定した上での説だ。
sen.e: The common belief stated above is a theory which identified a "rumor" of the Iga clan's rebellion described in the article of June 28th of Joo era in "Azuma Kagami" (a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu) as a fact.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The common belief stated above is a theory which identified the "rumor" of the Iga clan's rebellion described in the article of June 28th of Joo era in "Azuma Kagami" (a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura bakufu) as a fact.
sen.cmt: ・rumorは特定されているため、定冠詞に変えました。・統一のため、Bakufu→bakufuとしました。
sen.e: The common belief stated above is a theory which identified the "rumor" of the Iga clan's rebellion described in the article of June 28th of Joo era in "Azuma Kagami" (a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura bakufu) as a fact.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 吾妻鏡の記事中では、鎌倉入りの前に事前調査させた泰時によって「謀反の噂は事実ではなく、騒ぎ立てるな」と伊賀氏謀反は否定されている。
sen.e: In "Azuma Kagami", it is stated that Yasutoki HOJO had investigated on the matter before entering the capital of Kamakura, and denied the rebellion of the Iga clan as "an untrue rumor which should not be made a fuss about".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In "Azuma Kagami," it is stated that Yasutoki HOJO had investigated on the matter before entering the capital of Kamakura, and denied the rebellion of the Iga clan as "an untrue rumor which should not be made a fuss about."
sen.cmt: ・指示に従って、コンマおよびピリオドはクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: In "Azuma Kagami," it is stated that Yasutoki HOJO had investigated on the matter before entering the capital of Kamakura, and denied the rebellion of the Iga clan as "an untrue rumor which should not be made a fuss about."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この事件は、すでに将軍家と血縁もなく、北条本家との関係も希薄となって影響力の低下を恐れた政子が、牧氏事件と同じ構図を創り上げて義時後家として強い立場を持つ事になる伊賀氏を強引に潰そうとして仕掛けたものとする見方もある。
sen.e: Some says Masako HOJO, in fear of decline of her own influence in Kamakura Bakufu due to having no blood relationship with the Shogun family and the weak connection with the head family of HOJO, designed this incident, which has the same content with the Incident of Maki clan, in order to forcibly ruin the Iga clan, who were to hold strong power as Yoshitoki's widow

Some say Masako HOJO, in fear of decline of her own influence in the Kamakura bakufu due to having no blood relationship with the Shogun family and the weak connection with the head family of HOJO, designed this incident, which has the same content with the Incident of Maki clan, in order to forcibly ruin the Iga clan, who were to hold strong power as Yoshitoki's widow.
sen.cmt: ・Someは複数名を指すため、says→sayとしました。・ピリオドが抜けていました。・orderの後の余分なスペースを削除しました。・統一のため、Bakufu→bakufuとしました。定冠詞も追加しました。
sen.e: Some say Masako HOJO, in fear of decline of her own influence in the Kamakura bakufu due to having no blood relationship with the Shogun family and the weak connection with the head family of HOJO, designed this incident, which has the same content with the Incident of Maki clan, in order to forcibly ruin the Iga clan, who were to hold strong power as Yoshitoki's widow.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 泰時は政子の画策には乗らずに事態を沈静化させ、政子によって処罰された伊賀光宗らも政子の死後すぐに幕府に復帰させている。
sen.e: Yasutoki HOJO, not taken in by Masako's plot, calmed the state of affairs, and had Mitsumune IGA and others who were punished by Masako reinstated to the Kamakura Bakufu.
Yasutoki HOJO, not taken in by Masako's plot, calmed the state of affairs, and had Mitsumune IGA and others who were punished by Masako reinstated to the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 統一のため、Bakufu→bakufuとしました。
